metadata.titel_preek: How to Dress for a Wedding: Salisbury

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God (the King) prepares a cosmic banquet of joy and salvation for all humanity, actively inviting and providing the necessary 'garment' (Christ) for the guests to participate in His eternal celebration.

tekstueel_bewijs: God has poured out in preparing for us.
God is going to have his party whether you and I are there or not.
Whomsoever the Lord invites he also supplies with clothing.

object.identificatie: Participation in the Marriage Supper of the Lamb (Salvation/Joy)
tekstueel_bewijs: An invitation to joy. It is an invitation to glory. It is an invitation to eternity.
The perfect party that will never end.
The kingdom of heaven may be compared to a king who gave a marriage feast for his son.

ontvanger.identificatie: Humanity (The 'bad and good' gathered from the streets)
tekstueel_bewijs: Gathered all whom they found, both bad and good.
It is your own personal invitation to joy.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver who is invited despite unworthiness.

tekstueel_bewijs: Put on the Lord Jesus Christ.
The marriage of Christ the Bridegroom to the Church his Bride.
helper.rol_van_god: God is Subject; Christ is the provided means (Helper) of entry.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicitly the power that enables 'putting on' Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: We go off to our farms, we go off to our businesses.
Our unwillingness to put on the garment that God gives us.
If they can’t climb past someone else to get there, they won’t have fun.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a mistake but a fundamental rejection of God's reality in favor of self-importance, leading to 'outer darkness'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical life of the believer (putting on Christ) as a response to the invitation.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Living in hope and taking interest in 'God's children' (justice/mercy).
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical 'putting on' is only possible because the King first invited the guest and supplied the clothes.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God → Salvation/Joy → All People (Bad and Good)
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Christ → God (as Primary Actor) ← Human Apathy/Pride

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord GOD will wipe away tears.
God is going to have his party.
Whomsoever the Lord invites he also supplies.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We go off to our farms.
We need to reflect on the care and love.

voorbeelden: Why should a wedding guest... be expected to have a party outfit?
Unwillingness to put on the garment.
In order to understand what Jesus is getting at...
A free welcome to a royal wedding feast.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's 'Pouvoir' (Power/Grace) to enable the guest to attend, rather than the guest's 'Devoir' (Duty) to earn the spot.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the Apathy (Not-S2) of the invited, through the Pride (Not-S1) of the man without a garment, to the Grace (S1) of God who provides the clothing.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in Christ as the garment provided by the King, bridging the gap between the 'bad' guest and the 'holy' hall.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The 'outer darkness' is treated as a real consequence of refusing the provided grace.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the initiator and provider. Even the requirement (the garment) is interpreted through Calvin as something God provides.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: It means taking a new interest in God’s children...

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Whomsoever the Lord invites he also supplies with clothing.
Gathered all whom they found, both bad and good.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The sermon avoids 'Be like the good guests.' Instead, it highlights that all guests are 'bad and good' and only stay because of the King's provision.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God is the host who overcomes human rudeness and social barriers.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and gratitude; a shift from social anxiety to spiritual security.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The primary program (God saves) and secondary program (We respond) are perfectly ordered; response is a 'putting on' of what is given.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The guest puts on Christ (the garment) to stand before the King.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon attributes the gift of the garment to 'The Lord' generally.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Serious; results in 'speechlessness' and 'outer darkness' if not covered by Christ.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of a grace-oriented actantial structure where God is the Subject of salvation and the Provider of the means of grace.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The transition to 'putting on Christ' as an ethical act is well-handled as a consequence of the gift.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful homiletical move using Calvin's interpretation to ensure God remains the Subject even of the 'requirement' of the text.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'party' metaphors, Greimas reveals that the 'engine' of the sermon is God's provision of the garment, not the guest's effort to find one.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might struggle with the violence of the King; the actantial model shows this violence is the logical boundary of rejecting the Subject's (God's) total provision.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'Wedding Garment' functions as a 'Helper' actant provided by the 'Sender' to the 'Subject', confirming a high-grace theology.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully navigates a difficult 'judgment' text by keeping the actantial focus on God's hospitality.
